text:
Hello!

I'm migrating a project from `HubSpot/HubSpot-php` to `HubSpot/api-client`

That project has some methods related to `engagements()` and I don't know how to migrate them, because I think there is no endpoints to get all `engagements`, for example.

Something similar happens when updating/removing an `engagement`. I have the ID, but not the type, so...

Could you help me? Thank you!
sorry think I linked the wrong one: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/analytics/get-analytics-data-by-object>
The v3/v4 endpoints don't really say how to do this or if it's even possible

2 options though:
you could use the normal contacts endpoint to figure out everyones ids

or you could use the v1 endpoint <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/batch_create_or_update>
to do the update
you'll notice that the syntax is a little different but not super hard to convert the v4 request body for the v1 endpoint
let me know which one you pick
Hello everyone, some one can show me hot connect a graphql query with the HubSpot api ?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql#use-a-graphql-query-in-an-api-request>
Thank you so much for the response, i think i will go with the 1st option
Yeah definitely not a bad option

Hi folks…I have a Feedback API question.

The Feedback API Documentation (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/feedback-submissions>), states the following: *Please note: the feedback submissions endpoints are currently read only. Feedback submissions cannot be submitted or edited through the API.* 

However, the endpoints now show create capabilities:
*Create a feedback submission with the given properties and return a copy of the object, including the ID. Documentation and examples for creating standard feedback submissions is provided.*

The Private App scopes still only have Read capabilities. Has any heard anything about a timeline on write capabilities with this API?
I honestly don't know but it you haven't already I would submit a support ticket for this.
It helps the HubSpot prioritize things like this

Hey everyone, I would love some help here and I’m a bit out of my range with this one.

I have a nodejs site that isn’t tracking the initial page view and landing page form submissions from the initial page view come up as Direct even if they’re coming from Google Organic.

• The base HubSpot tracking code is firing on All Pages
• There’s a Subsequent Page View fired from a Pageview Event calling on `_hsq.push(['trackPageView']);`
• setPath isn’t set up and to be honest I’m not sure if it should be. If so, I’m not sure how to go about adding the url parameters dynamically in javascript after the ‘<http://domain.com/|domain.com/>’
Any help here is greatly appreciated :pray:
`location.href` in javascript will return the full url
You're just looking for passing the url to the HubSpot tracking?
Yes and also trying to solve for the lack of original source
Should I have the trackPageview fire on the initial page view? I was able to test it out and it fired correctly in GTM preview but I was unsure if this was correct.
Anyone have any idea about this? I went ahead and added read/write line_items scope to be safe, but was just curious why they were not required to read/write line items.
Are you sure you were using the same tokens?
Haven't tested this myself just throwing out ideas

Hi all, I'm having an issue with call tasks.

When a user creates a new call task associated with a contact that has already had a call task completed, the new call task's status shows up as "Completed" in the API, even though in the UI it's showing up as "Not Started" as expected.

Also, the "Createdate" shows up as the date I created the original task that got completed, not the new task (only the "lastmodifieddate" gets updated to when I most recently created the task). Also, the call task title shows up as the old call task title, even though for the new call task I called it something else.

For example, for the task in the screenshot below, I first created it on Feb 5 and completed it, and created a new call task with the same person on Feb 7.

Not sure if this is a bug in the API or by design, but does anyone have a way around this? More specifically, is there a way to see that the task hasn't actually been completed, even though "hs_taskstatus" shows up as completed?
So is the only domain you're tracking?

So you’d want to figure out if the domain is important or not, if domain, use the window.location.href, if this is the only domain you are tracking, just use the pathname
In GTM you might want to set these up as VARIABLES to include them in the code or you can use JS to get this information. Make sure you are setting this on “page view”
```var page = window.location.href // use this if you're tracking multiple domains and want to keep them seperate
window.location.pathname //use this if you have one domain or don't care about keep them seperate
_hsq.push(['setPath', page ]);
_hsq.push(['trackPageView']);```
Here's the docs if you don't already have it: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code>
This section will really help you if you want to identify users: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code#identify-a-visitor>
The tokens I was using definitely didn’t have line_item read/write as those scopes weren’t selected when I went to check the scope configuration under basic info > auth tab > scopes > selected scopes
Yeah very interesting, let me run a test when I hop back on tomorrow.
